## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
# First step: Removing entire rows
# Remove rows with FIRST LADY or VICE PRESIDENT in the title
library(dplyr)

patterns <- c('First Lady', 'Vice President', 'MENSAJE SEMANAL', 'Jill Biden', 'FACT SHEET', 'FLOTUS', 'Declaraciones')

obama_csv1 <- filter(obama_csv, !grepl(paste(patterns, collapse="|"), speech))
```

```{r}
# I decided to focus on using Obama's Weekly Addresses and State of the Union speeches
weekly <- c('WEEKLY ADDRESS', 'Weekly Address')
obama_weekly_address <- filter(obama_csv1, grepl(paste(weekly, collapse="|"), speech))

write.csv(obama_weekly_address, "/Users/cynthiachen/Desktop/Obama_Weekly.csv")

sotu <- c('State of the Union')
obama_sotu <- filter(obama_csv1, grepl(paste(sotu, collapse="|"), speech))

write.csv(obama_sotu, "/Users/cynthiachen/Desktop/Obama_Sotu.csv")
```


```{r cars}
# Final edits for the State of the Union portions of Obama's speeches.
# I ended up using Jupyter to get rid of the (Applause) and (Laughter) parts
obama_sotu_final = read.csv("/Users/cynthiachen/Desktop/Obama_Sotu_Final.csv")
obama_sotu_final1 <- obama_sotu_final[-6, ]
# Then I used Sublime Text to get rid of some extraneous text at the beginning.
write.csv(obama_sotu_final1, "/Users/cynthiachen/Desktop/Obama_Sotu_Final1.csv")
```

